sections.heading: of farm-raised deer that are not white-tailed deer.
sections.text: of farm-raised deer that are not white-tailed deer.

sections.heading: viewers.The supervisors in their respective towns, the alderpersons of cities in their respective aldermanic districts, and the trustees of villages in their respective villages shall be fence viewers
sections.text: viewers.The supervisors in their respective towns, the alderpersons of cities in their respective aldermanic districts, and the trustees of villages in their respective villages shall be fence viewers.

sections.heading: fences; space between ground and bottom.
sections.text: fences; space between ground and bottom.

sections.heading: fences; when required.The respective occupants of adjoining lands used and occupied for farming or grazing purposes, and the respective owners of adjoining lands when the lands of one of such owners is used and occupied for farming or grazing purposes, shall keep and maintain partition fences betwee
sections.text: fences; when required.The respective occupants of adjoining lands used and occupied for farming or grazing purposes, and the respective owners of adjoining lands when the lands of one of such owners is used and occupied for farming or grazing purposes, shall keep and maintain partition fences between their own and the adjoining premises in equal shares so long as either party continues to so occupy the lands, except that the occupants of the lands may agree to the use of markers instead of fences, and such fences shall be kept in good repair throughout the year unless the occupants of the lands on both sides otherwise mutually agree.

sections.heading: fences.Where the 2 parties, one of whom is the state or a subdivision thereof, agree that a fence is reasonably necessary, the duty to erect and maintain partition fences shall apply equally to the state, as provided in s
sections.text: 90.03, and its subdivisions as occupants of lands whenever such lands are boun

sections.heading: of fences on action for trespass by animals
sections.text: Owners of lands who do not maintain and keep in repair lawful partition fences may not recover any damages for trespasses by the animals of owners of any adjoining lands with whom partition fences might have been maintained if such lands had been enclosed;

sections.heading: Wisconsin Statutes updatedthrough 2025 Wis
sections.text: Act 82 and through all Supreme Court Orders and Controlled Substances Board Orders filed before and in effect on January 30, 2026.Published andcertifiedunder s. 35.18. Changes effective after January 30, 2026, are designated by NOTES.(Published 1-30-26)
